content: But so is the rapturous appeal of Trump’s narrative, which casts the people, neglected economically but more significantly neglected in status, as major participants in the American project once again. The hollowness of the rhetoric is easy to ignore when it carries so much rapture, as Bauerlein demonstrated an interview with Slate, where he described Trump’s inauguration address as less like demagoguery and “closer to the populism of Walt Whitman and his paean to the working man.”
